reviewText: I understand that the nature of Free-to-play games is to charge for extra in-game items but holy hell. This is the most relentless of all the games underneath that paradigm, with pop-ups telling you to JOIN VIP, and strategically placed BUY ME" buttons that show after LEVEL UP screens. It was when I got to the "FREE VIP" bit where I had enough
date:
and tried to close that window in the game.

It wouldn't let me close the window until I "joined VIP" for a free measly 6 hours.
So I closed the game and never opened it again.

reviewText:
If you're here because you enjoyed Tom Clancy's End War (or anything Tom Clancy)... turn back now. This is a dumbed down cookie-cutter" game created to grab your money.

This is a money-grabber game that will push ads in your face for their "premium membership." In the end I felt that investing money into this game would never be worthwhile and the adverts simply make it annoying to attempt to play.

You have up until level 10 to learn the tutorial and have an easy go at it. After level 10 you are bombarded with ads. Even for a free-to-play game I found that the gameplay was severely lacking and I felt that this game was not worth any more time.

It's unfortunate that UBI has to follow the way of EA and put garbage games like this out on the market when they could be using their resources for new and innovative AAA games."

reviewText:
I tried the game and of course .. enjoyed it for the first couple of hours and was thinking about how will this game be my new favorite then the next day the problems began..
1) The exhausting amount of time you have to wait for your Zones" to upgrade is hilarious.
2) The time-limit for some missions in the single-player mode is hilarious too some missions require like 5 minutes and you are asked to finish it before 2 minutes in order to get the star and that's just stupid.
3) Every time you log in you drown in the Ads which beg you to buy gold.
4) I wouldn't call the game P2W or Pay to Win .. I'd rather call it Freemium.
5) The amount of crashes and bugs and the loading screen issues needs to be fixed too.
Lastly
date: If you Devs want "Tom Clancy's Endwar Online" to be a successful game and not gonna end up in the trash can like many other free games or shut it down at some point due to 0 profit and no players you gotta take a SERIOUS look at those points mentioned above. Peace."

reviewText:
Give the game a few hours before judging yourself, I got to level 30+  without paying much for it and you probably will not progress much further unless you do. I only purchased the $1 to victory jumpstart offer. Gameplay is like ROCK PAPER SCISSORS  Enemy launches a unit you launch what will destroy it.... simple enough... so a few good and bad points listed below.

Good points
1 ITS FREE  Easy game play not hard on the grey matter
2 Daily rewards ie cargo locator which can give you a unit
3 gold energy and fame comes in steady amounts to a point to level up. USE WISLEY
4 Progression of campaign map is challenging but fun
5 Passes the time while chatting to friends on Team speak

Bad Points
1 You need to spend money to advance steadily in one month you could spend $60+ on VIP, War Bonds, Monthly gold pack. Which I will not.
2 Commander level up is too quick after 3+ star general PVP favours the coin spenders.
3 buggy  crashes/ freezes a few times.
4 Definately  not endwar the game I enjoyed in the past.
5 Not many play it so PVP 2x 2hr windows per day it is rare to combat like for like in skirmish mode.
6 I said its FREE but coin is needed to be spent to progress. Uninstalled after level 32.

reviewText:
Up points:
- No F Uplay. That would have been worth a positive review in itself if not for:

Down points:

1 hour was enough really. It is a quarter notch above mobile game (in terms of well... Everything).
Only the ingame shop is it a whole level above.
Parents beware. Let your kid(s) play this, and you and/or (he,she,it, that, they) could bring you to ruin. Drain your steam wallet and remove any stored credit card info. This game made unwise expenses -extremely- easy to make.

Also, I am pretty sure that I secured Paris in a much more climatic battle in the Original Endwar...
Did not encounter a insert credit card to continue" button. But the game does ask you every five seconds to buy gold to do... Everything that much faster.
Buy the original EndWar. At least it made an effort to be a good timesink."

reviewText:
Tom Clancy's EndWar Online is not a very good Tom Clancy game, that being said its more than decent clicker game! What game play comes down to is sending waves of units down different lanes towards an enemy base, the units have abilities they can use so you have to match up the different units and send them in an order that they will make the most progress against an enemy's wave. While the objective may sometimes vary, the most common way to win, in my experience has been to destroy the enemy's base or have them use up all there units.

Gameplay in end war online is broken into a singleplayer campaign and multiplayer, so its a clicker game you can play with friends. I feel that you may need to use more strategy than most games in the clicker genre, so thats a plus in my book.


There are however a few negatives I should put out there. The biggest being so is this is obviously a huge disappointment to most EndWar fans, being so different than the original EndWar game.  Another thing, that does not bother me so much as it does lots of other people is there is indeed a cash shop, thought it has not had any significant negative effect on my gameplay so far.

Overall I would recommend fans of clicker or mobile games try this, contrary to the title I do not think there is much here for the Tom Clancy fan.

reviewText:
Ok my first review on steam EVER!

Firstly ignore what people are saying its not a good game, IT IS a good game got a few hours in on the game
and its fun and addictive, BUT the only down side of it is the pay to win aspect now i dont mind that in any game ive played a few but this one is tottaly wrong in the pricing ok VIP i get, That's understandable in any free game there is always a VIP scheme now to the PREMIUM currency you guys need to fix this ♥♥♥♥ its expensive and its not even worth the money if you want to make money on this game either lower the price alot or give more for the money $20 for 2000 gold and that wont even get you a commander seriously ♥♥♥♥ing think who will be playing the game a bunch of people that go to work and make money HELL NO its for people who dont work or have some free time between. increase the gold or lower the price other wise the game will go dead in the water.

ook so for people that are wondering to download it or not  give it a go its free no pop up's ever except when launching the game and its only extra you can buy but its not worth it trust me, but for a stand alone and time waster its not half bad, except premium currency but you can get it in game i just dont agree with there pricing if it gave more for what there asking i would buy some but im not wasting hard earned money on a game i will play a few days a week when not working hell no
AAA title's cost less than it would to get all the commanders in this game to pay with cash.

Rant over download the game

Ignore the rest try it your self

reviewText:
Really dull Tower Defence game very loosely based off Tom Clancy's Endwar Game from 2008.

You read that Right, its Tower Defence. You deploy Tanks in Lanes and they drive towards the Enemey Tanks and then blow up instantly if they meet a Helicopter. So you Deploy AA Tanks, who Die Instantly they moment they meet normal Tanks.

Oh and you have Infantry and Artillery.

They suck even more.

Avoid.

reviewText:
I did not play this much. I started on the tutorial. It was .. not promising. You were told explicitly what to do all the time - all other options was grayed out - and for following the tutorial you were showered in 'rewards', praise, and levels all the time.

Outside of the tutorial, battles are a lane-based paper-scissor-rock affair. Tanks kill vehicles, get killed by air. Air kills tanks but gets killed by anti-air vehicles. Airstrikes remove pesky clusters of units.

There may - or may not - be some of the better gameplay in the genre in there, but I haven't gotten to it yet. For a Tom Clancy game, you'd expect at least a sense of realism (And the US shoudl be horribly overpowered) but it isn't there.

reviewText:
An honest review by someone who has played the game in closed Beta. Check this out!

First of all it is NOT pay to win. You can buy gold but you can just as easily build your army by, PLAYING the game. What a novel idea! The most determining factor in winning in EWO? Your BRAIN!

This is a great game! It has 5 different game modes. Campaign, Skirmish, Fortress, Wargames and Friendly match. These modes unlock as you play the game. If you are looking for instant gratification or are impatient this isn't for you. EWO is a game for a more mature audience who enjoys building an army according to thier strategy of warfare. This is not the basic rock, paper and scissors. The game has a deep level of unit progression with many different units to recruit. You have to learn the different abilities of these Commanders and how they compliment each other to form an army. The game eases you into the warfare. I have seen many players rush through the Campaign mode only to get their butt kicked in skirmish because they didn't take time to recruit and train their Commanders. The game has a HQ area that has to leveled up. Weapons, armor, offensive and defensive systems all must be attained and ranked up.

I'm not talking about earning a new skin that changes your camo like in COD. Everything and I mean everything in this game is inter-twined into the effectivness of your army. You need to play not just Campaign but also Fortress, Wargames and Skirmish as they all play an important role in the total game. Map strategy is NOT basic. The best of this game will lose. That is because there is a counter for every strategy on every map.

In my honest opinion you cannot judge this game fairly until you have reached level #25. At that point you can play every mode. Reaching #1, on Platinum level #1 of Fortress is very hard. Playing Skirmish you will soon learn where your weakness's are and what you need to do to be competitive. If you take this game with a grain of salt, you will get eaten up and spit out. I challenge anyone to beat me! A few have and we respect each other. You may steam roll a few players spamming units at low levels. When you finally get to play with the Big Boys" you will get a spanking. So take this as fair warning! If you under estimate the game then you will most certainly under estimate your opponent.

Last
date: EWO has a great community! You can easily find players willing to help you with the more advanced strategies and questions. I'm always available and willing to help anyone improve their game!\n\nMARSFLYBOY"

reviewText: If you are a fan of EndWar, just move on and forget you saw it like this. For your own sake.\n\nThis is a generic poorly written pay-to-win tower defense game, or, if you're being generous, perhaps a solitaire moba. EndWar Online makes less sense on Steam than it might on Facebook or your parent's smartphone. If you are looking for EndWar-style gameplay, don't play this. If you're looking for EndWar-style storytelling, don't play this. If you have a bile fascination, there are less depressing places to satisfy it.

reviewText: Don't buy this game. I installed it just to write this review. This is the worst piece of trash I have ever played and what makes it worse is that it came from a truly unique and enjoyable idea. EndWar 1 was fun, it was furious, it was addicting. This game is none of those things and turned into a lane based mobile ♥♥♥♥♥torm. Don't support developers that are too lazy to make actual games, who cannibalize and monopolize their franchises with this microtransaction cancer. If we don't stand as one against developers doing this, it won't just be EndWar Online, it will be Call of Duty Online, Pokemon Online (as a matter of fact this one is actually closer to reality, Pokemon GO I'm looking at you) Dragonball Z Online. Whatever. You get the point,  this isn't quality gaming. This is mobile gaming cancer that needs to be eradicated via starvation.\n\nSend Ubisoft and other gaming companies a clear message: we will not stand for this garbage. We deserve more from you and that's the bottom line. Anyone who has any respect for themselves and the culture of gaming will stay as far away from this as humanly possible. Keep gaming bro's and bro-ettes, ,I'm out.
